name: Homemade Sausage Rolls
description: Recipe video above. "The secret is the bacon..." It really takes this sausage roll to another level! Also, sautéing the onion and celery before mixing into the filling makes it sweet and more moist than the usual, and using panko instead of normal breadcrumbs also contributes to making the filling of this sausage roll so moist.The addition of fennel adds an extra burst of flavour but it's optional. Pork and fennel are great mates and though most everyday suburban bakeries won't use it, you'll find better bakeries use it (like Bourke St Bakery). If you're wary, drop it to 1/2 teaspoon. Or just skip it!
recipeIngredient: 5 oz / 150g   bacon (, finely minced (streaky and fatty, not the lean stuff!))
2 1/2 sheets  puff pastry (, thawed then each cut into half (Note 3))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a non stick fry pan over medium high heat. Sauté garlic, onion & celery for 2 minutes, then add bacon.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a non stick fry pan over medium high heat. Sauté garlic, onion & celery for 2 minutes, then add bacon.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for a further 2 minutes (don't make bacon golden) then transfer to bowl and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for a further 2 minutes (don't make bacon golden) then transfer to bowl and allow to cool for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining Filling ingredients into the bowl. Use your hands to mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining Filling ingredients into the bowl. Use your hands to mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Lay out a rectangle of pastry, long edge closest to you. Brush egg along one long edge.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay out a rectangle of pastry, long edge closest to you. Brush egg along one long edge.

recipeInstructions.text: Get 1/5 th of the filling and shape into a long log shape down the middle of the pastry. Ensure the meat is tight and compact, without gaps.
recipeInstructions.name: Get 1/5 th of the filling and shape into a long log shape down the middle of the pastry. Ensure the meat is tight and compact, without gaps.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush edge of pastry with egg. Then roll up, finishing with the seam side down.Roll up, sealing on the edge with egg wash on it .
recipeInstructions.name: Brush edge of pastry with egg. Then roll up, finishing with the seam side down.Roll up, sealing on the edge with egg wash on it .

recipeInstructions.text: If you have time/patience, refrigerate for 1 hour (makes it easier/neater to cut)
recipeInstructions.name: If you have time/patience, refrigerate for 1 hour (makes it easier/neater to cut)

itemListElement.text: Cut each log into four equal lengths, or just two if you want full size sausage rolls. Brush with egg.
itemListElement.name: Cut each log into four equal lengths, or just two if you want full size sausage rolls. Brush with egg.

itemListElement.text: Place on 2 baking trays lined with baking paper (or sprayed with oil). Bake for 30 - 35 minutes in total, swapping tray shelves at 20 minutes, or until the pastry is deep golden brown. (Note: The filling will still look pink because of the bacon, but it's easy to tell from texture that it's cooked)
itemListElement.name: Place on 2 baking trays lined with baking paper (or sprayed with oil). Bake for 30 - 35 minutes in total, swapping tray shelves at 20 minutes, or until the pastry is deep golden brown. (Note: The filling will still look pink because of the bacon, but it's easy to tell from texture that it's cooked)

itemListElement.text: Cool slightly on trays. Serve hot or warm with tomato sauce or ketchup!
itemListElement.name: Cool slightly on trays. Serve hot or warm with tomato sauce or ketchup!

review.reviewBody: Have been making these for years and hands down they’re the best sausage rolls ever!!!
Forgot the stars and to say that the recipe as written (apart from personal choice of amount of fennel) is perfect. No tweaking necessary!
Loved them! Not a massive fennel fan, so only used 1/2 tsp as recommended by Nagi. Still enough to create some interest but not enough to overpower. I used Pampas Puff. Delish!

Only had 300 gm of Pork Mince so peeled 200g of Hickory Smoked sausages and mixed in to make up 500gm. They tasted quite nice. Moist. Hubby thought they were a bit bitter...something in the sausages I expect. So it looks like I will just have to eat them myself.

Great go-to recipe. Also works with goat if you add extra bacon fat. However, I tend to use what I have at hand so, last night I grated half a large zucchini and cooked it off with the bacon ( it works, trust me), used beef mince and added two tablespoons of Rosella Fruit Chutney. Still came out fantastic!

Hi Nagi, this is a fantastic recipe and they also cook from frozen really well, thank you! I have one question, when I fried the onion, garlic and celery together, there was quite a lot of liquid pooling (around 4-6 Tbsp) when I poured this into the mixing bowl.  In your video it looked like there wasn't much excess liquid, so I decided to strain most of the liquid out - should I have left this in to make the sausage rolls more moist, or would this have made them soggy??  Thanks for your help!

I didn't read the recipe first, so just mixed all the ingredients together raw, then cooked. I don't like fennel, so added mixed herbs. They were the best sausage rolls I've ever made! Will definitely make again!

Has anyone frozen these when cooked?  How did that go?
I forgot to leave some uncooked.
These are amazing! Easy to make and now a new family fav.
Can they be frozen once cooked

Made these just for the kids for Christmas Day lunch while the adults enjoyed oysters and prawns. But the adults couldn’t stop tucking in! Next year I’ll save $$$ on seafood and just make sausage rolls.
Simple and delicious and I wouldn't change a thing!

Hi Marian - Panko breadcrumbs are VERY dry so 40g is about 3/4c. For a recipe like this (not baking, which is more exact) a cup is a cup is a cup. You want enough bread crumbs to absorb the fat and juices from the meat to keep the flavour in the sausage rolls. Go ahead and make them - they're fabulous !
Just made. Double batch . Recommend the fennel. How delicious can a sausage roll get! Another winner thank you !!!!
